sorular.soru: How does taking a call like this affect your thinking time?
cevaplar: It has no effect on your thinking time.

feedback.metin: Making phone calls while operating a vehicle increases your thinking time by more than half a second. This means that you will react much slower.

sorular.soru: What should you do?
cevaplar: Drive on smoothly, allowing the bus to pull up behind you.
Slow down and let the bus go ahead.
sorular.dogruCevap: Slow down and let the bus go ahead.

feedback.metin: The rule that says you must give way to buses indicating that they want to leave a bus stop only applies in built-up areas. Here you are driving in a built-up area. You must therefore slow down and let the bus pass.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this warning light is on?
cevaplar: Keep driving until you can safely stop and call the garage or breakdown service.
Keep driving and report the malfunction at the next required APK inspection.
Stop immediately. Continuing to drive can lead to serious damage to the car.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep driving until you can safely stop and call the garage or breakdown service.

feedback.metin: If the "engine management malfunction" warning light comes on, it is wise to call the garage or breakdown service. If the vehicle still drives normally and the light is orange, not red, you do not have to stop immediately. Calmly drive to a safe place and stop the vehicle. If you notice that the vehicle loses power or functions poorly in any way, it is wise to stop immediately.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: Parking on the carriageway of a priority road outside built-up areas is prohibited. However, you are not on the carriageway here, but in the verge. You are therefore allowed to park here.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?
cevaplar: Stop and give way to traffic on the intersecting road.
Stop and give right of way to drivers on the intersecting road.
Give way to traffic on the intersecting road.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop and give right of way to drivers on the intersecting road.

feedback.metin: The B-7 sign indicates that you must give right of way to drivers on the intersecting road. You are also required to come to a full stop before the stop line, even if there are no approaching road users. You are not required to give way to crossing pedestrians.

sorular.soru: Where does the speed limit in a 30 km/h zone apply?
cevaplar: Until the "end of 30 km/h zone" sign.
sorular.dogruCevap: Until the "end of 30 km/h zone" sign.

feedback.metin: If the word "zone" is placed above a traffic sign, this means the traffic sign applies to an entire area, until it is cancelled by the "end zone" sign.

sorular.soru: Should you take into account glare when exiting a tunnel during the day?

feedback.metin: Tunnels are often very dark, which is why you must also use dipped headlights. Your eyesight is also worse in the dark. When exiting a tunnel, keep in mind that your eyes need some time to readjust to the daylight, which may be quite blinding at first.

sorular.soru: How many metres may an indivisible load protrude behind the car?

feedback.metin: If you are carrying an indivisible load, it should not protrude more than 1 metre from the front and rear of the car.

sorular.soru: Which sign indicates who should give way?

feedback.metin: The F-6 sign indicates that drivers coming from the opposite direction must give way to traffic approaching from this direction. The C-5 sign indicates that the road can be taken in two directions and does not specify who must give way to who.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to put a sticker on your number plate?

feedback.metin: Altering a number plate or making it unrecognisable or illegible is prohibited.

sorular.soru: In which situation are you allowed to turn right?

feedback.metin: In situation A, the traffic controller is giving a stop sign for the traffic approaching from behind. In situation B, the traffic controller is giving a stop sign for the traffic approaching him from the front. In situation A you can drive straight on, turn left and right. In situation B you have to stop.

sorular.soru: The weather is sunny. Should you use your lights here?

feedback.metin: In wooded areas, you can be hindered by the sun's glare through the tree branches in sunny weather. This impacts your visibility as well as making it difficult for other traffic to see you. The use of dipped headlights is mandatory here.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake at a speed of 100 km/h on this road?

feedback.metin: The green line in the middle indicates that this is an autoweg with a speed limit of 100 km/h. You can overtake here because the double line is not solid but broken.

sorular.soru: Is theft always covered by car insurance?

feedback.metin: Not all insurance policies pay out in the event of theft. If you only have third-party insurance, insurance will not pay out in the event of damage to or theft of your vehicle. If you have a limited hull or full hull (all-risk) insurance, insurance will pay out in the event of theft under certain conditions.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: You are driving on the incorrect side of the median. If the road is divided into two lanes by a wide median, you should use the right lane. Usually, this is indicated by traffic signs, but even if this is not the case, you should use the right lane.

sorular.soru: May the horn of a passenger car play a song?

feedback.metin: A horn should have one fixed pitch. It should not play a song.

sorular.soru: Is number plate lighting mandatory?
cevaplar: Yes. Both at the front and rear.
Yes. But only at the rear.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. But only at the rear.

feedback.metin: Passenger cars must be fitted with rear number plate lighting. Front number plate lighting is not necessary. If your rear number plate lighting is broken, you are not allowed to operate the vehicle.

sorular.soru: Do you have right of way here?

feedback.metin: The traffic light has the shape of a circle, not an arrow, which means oncoming traffic may have a green light at the same time as you. The rule that right-turn traffic precedes left-turn traffic continues to apply here. The black vehicle is turning right and therefore has right of way.

sorular.soru: At which sign are you allowed to go straight ahead?

feedback.metin: Sign F-7 indicates a prohibition from U-turning. You are allowed to drive straight ahead. Sign D-5 indicates a compulsory direction of travel. On this intersection you are only allowed to turn right and therefore you are not allowed to go straight ahead.

sorular.soru: Is this an equivalent intersection?

feedback.metin: This is an equivalent intersection, where traffic is not regulated by a traffic controller, traffic lights, or traffic signs. Drivers must give right of way to other drivers approaching from the right.

sorular.soru: What is the correct way to wear a seatbelt?
cevaplar: As close to your neck as possible.
Without slack around your hip and chest.
Without slack around your hip and under your armpit.
sorular.dogruCevap: Without slack around your hip and chest.

feedback.metin: You tighten your seatbelt around your hip after fastening it. The roll-up system makes sure that it sits across your chest with no slack. Always wear your seatbelt over your collarbone, in between your shoulder and neck. Make sure the seatbelt is not too close to your neck and never wear your seatbelt under your armpit. If you do, the seatbelt does not keep your upper body in place during a collision and the chances are that you will hit your head against the dashboard or windshield. This can lead to serious injuries or even death.

sorular.soru: After an accident, a driver complains of neck pain. What should you do?
cevaplar: Keep them in the car and hold their head.
With the help of bystanders, get the person out of the car and lay him flat on the ground.
You let the driver get out of the car and make him lie on the ground.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep them in the car and hold their head.

feedback.metin: You should move victims of a crash as little as possible. Does someone complain about neck or back pain? Then you never take them out of the car, unless keeping them in the car is more dangerous. Think of a fire or when they are on a railroad crossing. Sit behind (or in front) of the victim and hold their head so that they cannot move it anymore.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake this lorry?

feedback.metin: Sign F-3 indicates a prohibition for lorries to overtake other motor vehicles. This sign does not apply to passenger cars. You are therefore allowed to overtake.

sorular.soru: You want to transport three children on this back seat for a children's party. Is that allowed?

feedback.metin: You are required to use your seat belts, also on the back seat. In addition, there may not be more people in the car than there are seat belts present. This back seat only has two seat belts. Only a maximum of two people may be transported on this seat.

sorular.soru: Can you load or unload goods here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park or wait next to a solid yellow line. You are not allowed to load or unload or pick up or drop off passengers here. The latter is allowed next to a broken yellow line.

sorular.soru: What is the best course of action in the event of a strong crosswind?

feedback.metin: The biggest risk posed by a strong crosswind is that the wind pushes your vehicle to the left or right, forcing it off course. In this situation, you must lower your speed by releasing the accelerator and maintaining greater lateral distance. Bear in mind that you will need to countersteer against gusts of wind. This is most difficult when overtaking lorries and can even happen when driving under a viaduct. Wind bags or flags are placed in areas that see frequent gusts of wind, enabling drivers to anticipate gusts of wind and the direction from which they come.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: The cycle path is so far away from the roundabout that it is no longer a component of the roundabout. That means that this has become a regular intersection. In this case, the cyclist also has the B-6 sign (give way to drivers on the intersecting road) and priority triangles. The cyclist must therefore give way to you.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to use the front fog lights in this situation?

feedback.metin: The front fog lights may be used when visibility is significantly obstructed due to fog, rain, or snow. Visibility of less than 200 metres is used as a guideline. The rear fog lights may only be used when visibility is less than 50 metres due to fog or snow. Using the rear fog lights is prohibited in heavy rain, as it may blind other road users.

sorular.soru: What is the best thing to do?

feedback.metin: When a driver performs a dangerous overtaking manoeuvre, try to avoid an accident. As the overtaking driver's speed is higher than your speed, you can make way for that driver by braking. And if an accident does occur, a lower speed is always safer. Never steer into the verge, as this will put yourself in danger.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake like this?

feedback.metin: Overtaking should normally be done on the left-hand side. There are a number of exceptions when you can or even have to overtake on the right, like when the vehicle in front of you is indicating an intention to turn left, and is presorting to do so. It is also allowed when overtaking a tram, on the right side of the block marking, in case of a traffic congestion, and on and just before roundabouts. None of these exceptions apply here.

sorular.soru: What is the biggest risk here?
cevaplar: That the red passenger car does not see the white passenger car.
That the white passenger car does not see the red passenger car.
That the lorry is going to take the bend too wide.
sorular.dogruCevap: That the white passenger car does not see the red passenger car.

feedback.metin: The pre-sorted lorry is blocking the white passenger carâ€™s view, so they cannot see the red passenger car. The white car must give way to the red car. As he cannot see the red passenger car, the driver may wrongly assume that the road is clear and continue driving, increasing the risk of a collision.

sorular.soru: Cargo prevents you from seeing in the right wing mirror. Are you allowed to drive?

feedback.metin: Visibility in the wing mirrors should never be obstructed by cargo. Vision in the rearview mirror may be obstructed if necessary, if visibility in the wing mirrors is sufficient.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to turn left here?

feedback.metin: The sign indicates that you can only turn right at this junction. You are not allowed to turn left here.

sorular.soru: The ladder on this 3 metres long trailer is protruding 2 metres. Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: An indivisible load may protrude a maximum of half the length of the trailer, which in this case means the load may only protrude a maximum of 1.5 metres. In addition, the load must be secured, and have a marking sign if it protrudes more than 1 metre.
